text: Palomar Mountain is a mountain ridge in the Peninsular Ranges in northern San Diego County, California. It is known for the Palomar Observatory. == Climate == The KÃ¶ppen climate classification says that Palomar Mountain has a warm- summer Mediterranean climate. Oak, pine, fir and cedar trees grow there. It rains an average of a year. It snows a year. The coldest temperature ever recorded was on 25 January 1949. The hottest was on 22 August 1969. == References == Category:Mountains of California Category:San Diego County, California
title: Palomar Mountain
